tagged_story_for_tts:
1941.10.13 – Newark, NJ: Co-founded Simon & Garfunkel (1957), crafted The Sound of Silence (1964), Bridge Over Troubled Water (1970) – 10x Grammy winner. <[silence:1000ms]>
Solo: Graceland (1986) fused South African mbaqanga with pop, defied apartheid-era boycotts, sold 16M+ – Diamond on the Soles of Her Shoes, You Can Call Me Al. <[silence:1000ms]>
2018.07.15 – Retired after 60 years: songwriter, activist, UNICEF ambassador, Kennedy Center Honoree (2002). <[silence:1000ms]>
Legacy:

1941. 10. 13 – Newark, NJ: Co-founded Simon & Garfunkel (1957), crafted The Sound of Silence (1964), Bridge Over Troubled Water (1970) – 10x Grammy winner. 
Solo: Graceland (1986) fused South African mbaqanga with pop, defied apartheid-era boycotts, sold 16M+ – Diamond on the Soles of Her Shoes, You Can Call Me Al. 
2018. 07. 15 – Retired after 60 years: songwriter, activist, UNICEF ambassador, Kennedy Center Honoree (2002).
